title: Oil Price Drop Triggers a ‘Herd Mentality’ of Selling
summary: A decline of 9 percent in the per-barrel price since Tuesday, to below $50, reflects an increase in inventories. Still, analysts said they expected prices to bounce back.

title: Behind the Quiet State-by-State Fight Over Electric Vehicles
summary: While the battle in Washington gets much of the attention, the most direct attack against electric vehicles is being waged in statehouses.

title: Gazprom Makes Concessions in E.U. Gas Deal, but Trouble Looms for Russian Giant
summary: News of the provisional deal provides a welcome respite for the Russian energy company, and the government in Moscow, but the company still has serious issues.

title: Shocks, Recession and 9/11: When the Fed Intervenes
summary: The Federal Reserve has a history of changing interest rates to better steer the changing dynamic of the American economy. Here are several pivotal moments.

title: The Fed Acts. Workers in Mexico and Merchants in Malaysia Suffer.
summary: Rising interest rates in the United States are driving money out of many developing countries, straining governments and pinching consumers around the globe.

title: A Hotel Boom Comes to Texas
summary: Lured by the areas’ governmental support, major brands are planning to open an eye-opening number of hotels in Houston, Austin and Dallas.

title: U.S., in Reversal, Issues Permit for Keystone Oil Pipeline
summary: The decision by the Trump administration revives a contentious project, opposed by environmentalists, to transport oil from Canada to the Gulf Coast.

title: California Upholds Auto Emissions Standards, Setting Up Face-Off With Trump
summary: The backing of rules adopted in the Obama administration is one of the most direct moves so far to blunt President Trump’s effort to roll back regulations.

title: Tax on Saudi Aramco Oil Profits Is Cut to Prepare for I.P.O.
summary: Saudi Arabia is aiming to increase the company’s appeal to international investors as it gets ready to sell a 5 percent stake.

title: Policy Shift Helps Coal, but Other Forces May Limit Effect
summary: Reversing clean power rules may lead to more drilling and pipelines, but economics and state initiatives still favor natural gas and renewable energy.

title: Even Bold Foreign Investors Tiptoe in Iran
summary: Total, the French energy giant, is drawn by the promise of a lucrative market but is moving cautiously as it considers investing.

title: A Real Estate Boom, Powered by Pot
summary: The legalization of marijuana is upending the market for warehouses and retail stores, as companies pay a premium for places to grow and sell it.

title: When Solar Panels Became Job Killers
summary: A policy change in China hurt workers in Ohio, revealing the trade challenges facing President Trump.

title: A Talk With Yellen, and Debt Payments From Venezuela Are Due
summary: Janet Yellen, the Federal Reserve chairwoman, heads to the University of Michigan for a conversation with the economist Susan M. Collins.

title: A Russian Lake’s Future Hangs on Tourists and Toilets
summary: The fight to protect Lake Baikal, the world’s largest body of unfrozen freshwater, has shifted from industrial pollution to more mundane matters like sewage.

title: Europe Is Facing 4 Existential Tests. Can It Hold Together?
summary: A looming British exit from the European Union, talk of Scottish independence, a Dutch election and a spat with Turkey risk a further splintering of Europe.

title: Parliament Clears Way for ‘Brexit’ Talks as Scottish Vow Independence Vote
summary: Prime Minister Theresa May won her battle to start talks on Britain’s exit from the European Union, though the first minister of Scotland demanded a new referendum on Scottish independence.

title: Rex Tillerson Rejects Talks With North Korea on Nuclear Program
summary: The secretary of state, visiting South Korea, said for the first time that the Trump administration might act pre-emptively if the threat hit an unacceptable level.

title: Rex Tillerson and Xi Jinping Meet in China and Emphasize Cooperation
summary: The U.S. secretary of state and the Chinese president kept away from contentious issues even as North Korea defiantly showed off a new missile engine.

title: As Mexican State Limits Surrogacy, Global System Is Further Strained
summary: A Tabasco State law barring surrogate mothers from bearing children for foreigners reflects a troubled international system that, in one view, is “not sustainable.”

title: Ranks of Political Prisoners Grow as Democracy Ebbs in Venezuela
summary: At least 114 political prisoners are now behind bars in Venezuela, according to Penal Forum, a human rights organization that tracks political arrests in the country.

title: After Brexit, Scotland Lays a Path to Another Independence Vote
summary: Scotland’s Nicola Sturgeon is moving, post-Brexit, toward a second independence referendum against the wishes of British Prime Minister Theresa May.

title: How Does Populism Turn Authoritarian? Venezuela Is a Case in Point
summary: When Hugo Chávez took power nearly 20 years ago, the leftist populism he championed was supposed to save democracy. Instead, it has done the opposite.

title: Venezuelan Court Revises Ruling That Nullified Legislature
summary: The Supreme Court revised its decision to strip the legislature of its powers, but did not immediately publish the full ruling, leaving much unclear.

title: In Ecuador, Lenín Moreno Headed for Victory in Presidential Election
summary: A win for Mr. Moreno, a former vice president and close ally of departing President Rafael Correa, would be a rare victory for the Latin American left.
